title: Buddhism
summary: Buddhism (/ˈbʊdɪzəm/, US: /ˈbuːd-/)[1][2] is an Indian religion or philosophical tradition based on a series of original teachings attributed to Gautama Buddha.[3][4] It originated in ancient India as a Sramana tradition sometime between the 6th and 4th centuries BCE, spreading through much of Asia. It is the world's fourth-largest religion[5][6] with over 520 million followers, or over 7% of the global population, known as Buddhists.[7][8] Buddhism encompasses a variety of traditions, beliefs and spiritual practices largely based on the Buddha's teachings (born Siddhārtha Gautama in the 5th or 4th century BCE) and resulting interpreted philosophies.
